intro: Gyrostelma oxypetaloides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved gyrostelma, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or mountainous regions. It produces pink to reddish flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
